column2: michaiah, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I thought, wow I have allergies? Well after being prescribed  this medicine I knew it was right for me. I'm glad I went ahead and suffered the cost of a mere three hundred bucks. Ultimately, I'm glad I used this product.

column2: SoCal Sandra, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used these drops one time only. Because within 10 minutes of using them, one of my pupils became greatly enlarged, my blood pressure increased to a dangerous level and my heart rate was exceedingly high. I ended up in the ER as there was a concern of it being a stroke. The doctor determined it was an allergic reaction to the eye drops. Just be aware of a possible allergic reaction, as the manufacturer refused to acknowledge this possible reaction after I contacted them. So it is not listed as a contraindication or possible side effect in the information they provide.
FABULOUS!  By 8 PM it was like looking through vaseline.  No more.  Tremendous relief!  Too bad this stuff is sooooo expensive.

column2: Angiew, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Worked great on my allergies, but gave me a sore under my prosthetic eye.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Given sample to try.  Eyes still itching and irritated and feel worse like I have sand grit in my eyes.  Stopped med and went back to other eye drops I had been using.

column2: ginazmck, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Been using it on my 8 year old son this week and it's useless.  His eyes are still red as anything and he's complaining they are burning and running. Called the allergist to see if we can try something else. Poor kid, I wish it would have worked for him, he's miserable!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drop is the only thing that has worked for my crazy itchy eyes this weekend ! Get the big bottle as my insurance company was charging me the same for a bottle half the size. Hope this stuff works just as good as the allergy season rolls in !

column2: Carpe Diem, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It helped with my itching but I eventually stopped taking it because it I would actually taste the eye drops after a few minutes of putting them in my eyes.  The taste, which was kind of like a metallic taste, was just too much annoying.

column2: jose, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it does not work at all it only gives me dizzyness

column2: corkie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: easy to use but tastes nasty

column2: Mary, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has helped my eye condition, the only negative is the cost.
